department: Public Works and Government Services Canada
description: Trade Agreement: CFTA / FTAs with Peru / Colombia / Panama / Korea
full_summary:
**Title**
7.3-7.6m Aluminum Boat (Landing Craft) with Trailer

**Reference Number**
PW-_XLV-594-8433

**Solicitation Number**
5P423-220184/A

**Publication Date**
2023-02-16

**Tender Closing Date**
2023-03-14T17:00:00

**Abstract**
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites interested suppliers to submit a bid for the procurement of one 7.3-7.6 meter aluminum boat with trailer for Parks Canada. The delivery date for the boat is March 22, 2024. Bidders must be registered under the PWGSC Supply Arrangement # E60MC-190001 for Stream 11 - Greater than 6 Meters - Aluminum - Non-SOLAS - Welding Certification Required. This procurement is governed by the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and other applicable FTAs.

**Notice Type**
The notice type for this procurement is a Request for Bid.

**Procurement Method**
The procurement method for this project is a Competitive - Selective tendering.

**Trade Agreements**
This procurement is governed by the following trade agreements:

* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Regions of Delivery**
The region of delivery for this project is Alberta.

**Contact Information**
Birtwistle, Tracy
Tel.: (236) 464-0497
Email: tracy.birtwistle@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca

The bid must be submitted in either English or French.
**Notices**
Please note that the information in the Request for Bid is subject to change without prior notice. It is the bidder's responsibility to consult the Government of Canada's "Buy and Sell" website to obtain the most up-to-date information regarding this procurement.

By submitting this bid, the bidder acknowledges that they have read and understood the terms and conditions of the Request for Bid, and that they agree to abide by them. The Government of Canada reserves the right to negotiate with the winning bidder.

The successful bidder will be required to sign a contract with the Government of Canada. Failure to comply with the terms and conditions of the contract may result in cancellation or termination of the contract.
